bioghist.p: The National Society Sons and Daughters of the Pilgrims was founded in 1908 to preserve the genealogies and histories of the Pilgrims, which the society defines as "any immigrant who settled before 1700 within the territory which began the forty-eight contiguous states of the United States of America without regard to religion or place of origin." Members of the society must prove lineal descent from a Pilgrim. The Pennsylvania Branch was founded in 19?? and disbanded in 19??. A note on the national organization's website in 2007 indicated that the Pennsylvania chapter was in the process of reorganizing.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of meeting minutes (1921-1947) and original membership applications (1922-1982) from the Pennsylvania branch of the National Society Sons and Daughters of the Pilgrims. The applications include the name of the applicant, birth date and spouse's name, residence information, and lineage information. There are also several lists of members.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
